intro: Senecio leptolepis, commonly known as the narrowleaf senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Senecio leptolepis is often used in rock gardens due to its low maintenance and ornamental value.
